name: places/ChIJH-NE3p72wokRKRPztEY_jWI
formattedAddress: 300 Fort Washington Ave # 1, New York, NY 10032, USA
adrFormatAddress: 300 Fort Washington Ave # 1, New York, NY 10032-1323, USA

originalText.text:
"My recent visit to the doctor's office left me with mixed feelings. While the doctor himself was absolutely amazing, I cannot say the same about the rest of the staff. The level of professionalism and competence exhibited by the office workers was disappointing, to say the least.

When I arrived for my scheduled appointment, I was informed that the doctor was not working at that location on that particular day. This miscommunication was frustrating, especially considering that I had called beforehand to confirm my appointment. The staff's response was a simple apology and a request to come back the following week.

However, even when I called ahead to confirm the next appointment, I was informed that the doctor was once again unavailable that day. This inconsistency and lack of organization among the office workers left a lot to be desired. It's disheartening to encounter such unqualified individuals in a professional setting.

Despite these issues, I must emphasize that the doctor himself was exceptional. His expertise and care were evident during our encounter, and I have no complaints about his medical services.

In conclusion, while the doctor at this office is truly remarkable, the overall experience was marred by the unprofessionalism and lack of coordination exhibited by the staff. I hope that the management takes steps to address these issues, as they significantly impact the quality n care

originalText.text:
He could be the greatest doctor in the world but the wait time for an appointment is literally 2 hours. I arrived on time for my appointment, and the waiting room was packed with people all waiting to see the same doctor. The receptionist was very nice but when I asked how long the wait would be she said 1 hour (still a really long wait when you arrive on time for your appt) and that I could leave and come back if I wanted.

In the end it took 2 hours for him to see me, and the consultation took 5 minutes. He seemed nice and just got the colonoscopy scheduled and that was it, but the wait time is not cool.

Not based on him but just the wait time, if possible, schedule with anyone else.

originalText.text: I read all the one star reviews and thought, it couldn’t be that bad, right? But it was: I arrived for a 10am appointment and the waiting room was overstuffed with about two dozen people waiting, standing room only, and seemingly no one being seen. I waited 45 minutes before deciding to just cancel my appointment and I’m certain I wouldn’t have been seen before 2pm. The front desk staff are very kind, but they can’t do anything to speed things up when they overbook this much. Don’t make my mistake and save yourself the trip (unless this is your only option, in which case you should clear your schedule for the day and consider bringing your own chair).

originalText.text: Office waiting area is very small & can become very crowded very quickly. Dr Pou himself is pretty cool but he does seem to rush through the appointment that I had. I've only seen him a few times in like 4 years, I would recommend him for a short term treatment plan

originalText.text: Awful doctor. Unprofessional. No time for patients. No respect for people’s time. No regard for anything other than his needs and profit. Wait times are unforgivable and unimaginable. Just a terrible and unprofessional person who happens to have md after his name but doesn’t deserve the honor. He should pay his patients for their time. Pathetic all around.
